newsitem.title: USA: Motorola forms ColdFire standard committee.
newsitem.headline: Motorola forms ColdFire standard committee.

text.p: Motorola and 12 of its tool developers formed a software committee to develop standards for applications used in Motorola's ColdFire architecture, the company said on Monday.
The committee will draft an embedded application binary interface (EABI) standard to allow vendors to create interoperable software, Motorola said.

ColdFire is a family of processor chips based on the Motorola's 68-K core technology. The chips are used in mass storage and imaging, advanced consumer eletronics and wireless and wired communications, the company said.

"The ColdFire EABI standard will speed the critical design development cycle and deliver a faster time to market for ColdFire tool vendors and systems designers," said Mike Frawley, manager of system engineering and technical marketing for Motorola's embedded systems processors.
The ColdFire EABI standard will be developed by an industry-wide working group, including representatives from Motorola, Applied Microsystems and Integrated Systems Inc, Motorola said.
The committee expects to announce its results and make the first release of the standard available in the second half of this year, Motorola said.
